news.headline: Warner Bros. dominates Oscars amid Netflix–Paramount bidding war
news.summary: Warner Brothers says 93% of shareholders have rejected the inferior Paramount offer in favor of Netflix. This was in response to Paramount extending their offer deadline to mid-February.
news.article_text:
00:00 Speaker A

Well, the most nominated Oscar movie ever is now produced by Warner Brother's Discovery. Sinners bagged 16 nominations, further casting eyes on WBD's prize studio assets amid a fierce bidding war. WBD today saying 93% of shareholders have rejected the quote, inferior Paramount offer in favor of Netflix. This was in response to Paramount extending their offer deadline to mid-February. Brooke De Palma with me now. Brooke, what do you got?

00:26 Brooke DiPalma

So, essentially wha

news.headline: Paramount extends deadline for Warner Bros. offer, which company calls 'inferior scheme' amid Netflix deal
news.summary: Paramount Skydance extended the deadline for its bid to acquire Warners Bros. Discovery on Thursday. Warner Bros. continued to recommend shareholders vote for its deal to be bought by Netflix. Netflix announced an amended all-cash offer of $27.75 per share for Warner Bros.'
news.article_text:
Paramount Skydance (PSKY) extended the deadline for its bid to acquire Warners Bros. Discovery (WBD) on Thursday, while Warner Bros. continued to recommend shareholders vote for its deal to be bought by Netflix (NFLX) as the Hollywood studio drama continues to rock the media world.

Early Thursday, Paramount said in a new proxy filing that its all-cash, $30 per share offer to acquire all of WBD would be extended to Feb. 20; the initial bid was set to expire on Jan. 21. Earlier this week, Netflix

news.headline: Netflix Just Topped 325 Million Subscribers. Its Stock Price Sank Anyway.
news.summary: Netflix announced its fourth-quarter 2025 results on Tuesday afternoon. The company beat estimates for the quarter, reporting 18% revenue growth, an operating margin of 25%, and 30% growth in operating income. Despite all that, following the report, Netflix shares dropped by about 5% in after
news.article_text:
Despite the streaming video giant's strong growth in 2025, investors are wary about its 2026 spending plans -- and its high-priced bid to buy Warner Bros.

Netflix (NFLX 2.13%) shared some impressive stats with investors when it announced its fourth-quarter 2025 results on Tuesday afternoon. The streaming titan has surpassed 325 million paid memberships, giving it a global audience approaching 1 billion. And those viewers watched a total of 96 billion hours of video on its platform in the second

news.headline: Netflix says Paramount bid 'doesn't pass sniff test' as Warner battle intensifies, FT reports
news.summary: Netflix co-chief executive Greg Peters said the company is on track to win the backing of Warner Bros Discovery shareholders. Peters said only a "very small" number of WBD shares had been tendered in support of Paramount's hostile $108 ‌billion offer for the entire company.
news.article_text:
Jan 23 (Reuters) - Netflix (NFLX) co-chief executive Greg Peters said the company is on track to win the ​backing of Warner Bros Discovery (WBD) shareholders for its $82.7 ‌billion offer for the company's film and television studios, adding that Paramount's (PSKY) rival ‌bid "doesn't pass the sniff test", the Financial Times reported on Friday.

In an interview with the FT, Peters said only a "very small" number of WBD shares had been tendered in support ⁠of Paramount's hostile $108 ‌billion off
